intro: Tragacantha tenuispina, commonly known as the narrow-spined tragacanth, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces a distinctive gum that has been historically used in traditional medicine and as a natural adhesive. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and food for various insect species.
